intro: Triotosiphon lansbergii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with indirect sunlight. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, blue, and white, bloom throughout the year under proper care. Triotosiphon lansbergii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
